data.title: Very good Kosher sandwich shop.
data.text: This restaurant is located in a small strip mall with a good sized parking lot, especially since there are several available store fronts.  Located in one of the store fronts is The Sandwich Club.  The interior is nicely finished and will hold between 35 - 40 customers, though that might be tight.  The staff, especially David, was friendly.   You order at a counter and they bring you the food after examining the menu on the wall above the counter.  There are deli sandwiches and other types of sandwiches.  Several different soups - no sweet sour cabbage soup, though.  Most, if not all, of the sandwiches come with homemade potato chips.  The food was fresh and tasty.  We ordered a 3 taco platter and a tuna fish sandwich.  Both of us were happy with the taste.  This is a Kosher restaurant, so they are closed on Saturday.  The only slightly bad thing is the bathroom, as you do have to go through the kitchen to get to it.  But I can say the kitchen and bathroom were clean.   A bit more than some other places, but it was very fresh food.
